subhead: The US officially broke with decades of free trade at 12:01 am on Thursday, raising the average import tariff on goods from about 2% in January to 17.3% today.

subhead: The latest deaths came as Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu was expected to announce further military action – and possibly plans for Israel to fully reoccupy Gaza.

headline: War in Gaza causes rift within the British left
subhead: In the United Kingdom, Muslim communities and young urban voters have turned away from Labour, disappointed by its lack of initiative on the Palestinian conflict. Many say they are ready to join Jeremy Corbyn's new party.

headline: Outsider art: Two African artists somewhat lost amid the vast Decharme collection in Paris
subhead: At the Grand Palais, 402 works by 156 artists are on display in the Parisian building through September 21. Africa is represented by two draftsmen, one from Benin and one from Angola.

headline: The scars of Boko Haram on the shores of Lake Chad: 'At night, they are the masters'
subhead: 'Lake Chad's Troubled Waters' (2/4). Fifteen years after the insurgency began, successor factions of the jihadist group, though weakened, continue to spread terror around Lake Chad, which borders Niger, Nigeria, Cameroon and Chad.

Mojgan Habibi, chef: 'Before, I was afraid of everything. Now, I have found my freedom'
subhead: 'Refuge Recipes' (4/6). Iranian native Mojgan Habibi is the breakfast chef at Hôtel du Couvent in Nice. Khoresht mast, a dish reserved for special occasions and made with yogurt, spices, honey and meat, brings back memories of her happy youth in Isfahan before her marriage, when she was free to create and sing.

headline: Eva Nguyen Binh, head of the Institut Français: 'Attacking culture has long-term consequences'
subhead: The president of the Institut Français, a French overseas cultural policy actor which has just had its contract renewed, discusses the challenges that cultural diplomacy faces in a time of geopolitical tensions.

headline: Eighty years after Hiroshima and Nagasaki bombings, the fight for survivors' memories to live on
subhead: In Japan, the two cities have long promoted peace and nuclear disarmament, led by survivors of the 1945 nuclear bombings. As their voices fade, both cities are striving to carry their message forward.
